body:
Currently, this program compiles but emits incorrect output.

The AST is OK

```
(TranslationUnit [(Program array_constructor () [] [] [] [(Print 0 () [(* 10 (ArrayInitializer () () [1 2]))] ())] [])])
```

but there seems to be something wrong with the ASR:

```
(TranslationUnit (SymbolTable 1 {array_constructor: (Program (SymbolTable 2 {}) array_constructor [] [(Print () [(IntegerBinOp (IntegerConstant 10 (Integer 4 [])) Mul (ArrayConstant [(IntegerConstant 1 (Integer 4 [])) (IntegerConstant 2 (Integer 4 []))] (Integer 4 [((IntegerConstant 1 (Integer 4 [])) (IntegerConstant 2 (Integer 4 [])))])) (Integer 4 []) (IntegerConstant 1399762494276160 (Integer 4 [])))] () ())])}) [])
```

Then the LLVM output:

```llvm
; ModuleID = 'LFortran'
source_filename = "LFortran"

@0 = private unnamed_addr constant [2 x i8] c" \00", align 1
@1 = private unnamed_addr constant [2 x i8] c"\0A\00", align 1
@2 = private unnamed_addr constant [5 x i8] c"%d%s\00", align 1

define i32 @main() {
.entry:
  call void (i8*, ...) @_lfortran_printf(i8* getelementptr inbounds ([5 x i8], [5 x i8]* @2, i32 0, i32 0), i32 -673643968, i8* getelementptr inbounds ([2 x i8], [2 x i8]* @1, i32 0, i32 0))
  ret i32 0
}

declare void @_lfortran_printf(i8*, ...)
```

However, the Julia output is correct (although the output format is different from Fortran)

```julia
function main()
    println(10 * [1, 2])
end

main()
```
